00081 /*
00082 import bpy
00083 I = bpy.data.images['blender.png'] # the 48x48 icon
00084 
00085 # Write to a file that can be 
00086 # used within static unsigned char BLENDER_ICON_48x48x24[] = {...}
00087 f = open('/myicon.txt', 'w')
00088 for j in xrange(48):
00089         for k in xrange(48):
00090                 v = I.getPixelI(j,47-k)
00091                 v.pop()
00092                 for p in v:
00093                         f.write(str(hex(p))+',')
00094 
00095         f.write('\n')
00096 */
00097

00151 
00152 
00153 GLXContext GHOST_WindowX11::s_firstContext = NULL;
00154 
00155 GHOST_WindowX11::
00156 GHOST_WindowX11(
00157     GHOST_SystemX11 *system,
00158     Display * display,
00159     const STR_String& title, 
00160     GHOST_TInt32 left,
00161     GHOST_TInt32 top,
00162     GHOST_TUns32 width, 
00163     GHOST_TUns32 height,
00164     GHOST_TWindowState state,
00165     const GHOST_TEmbedderWindowID parentWindow,
00166     GHOST_TDrawingContextType type,
00167     const bool stereoVisual,
00168     const GHOST_TUns16 numOfAASamples
00169 ) :
00170     GHOST_Window(width,height,state,type,stereoVisual,numOfAASamples),
00171     m_context(NULL),
00172     m_display(display),
00173     m_normal_state(GHOST_kWindowStateNormal),
00174     m_system (system),
00175     m_valid_setup (false),
00176     m_invalid_window(false),
00177     m_empty_cursor(None),
00178     m_custom_cursor(None)
00179 {
00180     
00181     // Set up the minimum atrributes that we require and see if
00182     // X can find us a visual matching those requirements.
00183 
00184     int attributes[40], i, samples;
00185     Atom atoms[2];
00186     int natom;
00187     int glxVersionMajor, glxVersionMinor; // As in GLX major.minor
00188 
00189 #ifdef WITH_X11_XINPUT
00190     /* initialize incase X11 fails to load */
00191     memset(&m_xtablet, 0, sizeof(m_xtablet));
00192 #endif
00193 
00194     m_visual= NULL;
00195 
00196     if (!glXQueryVersion(m_display, &glxVersionMajor, &glxVersionMinor)) {
00197         printf("%s:%d: X11 glXQueryVersion() failed, verify working openGL system!\n", __FILE__, __LINE__);
00198         
00199         /* exit if this is the first window */
00200         if(s_firstContext==NULL) {
00201             printf("initial window could not find the GLX extension, exit!\n");
00202             exit(1);
00203         }
00204 
00205         return;
00206     }
00207 
00208     /* Find the display with highest samples, starting at level requested */
00209     for (samples = m_numOfAASamples; samples >= 0; samples--) {
00210         i = 0; /* Reusing attributes array, so reset counter */
00211 
00212         if(m_stereoVisual)
00213             attributes[i++] = GLX_STEREO;
00214 
00215         attributes[i++] = GLX_RGBA;
00216         attributes[i++] = GLX_DOUBLEBUFFER;
00217         attributes[i++] = GLX_RED_SIZE;   attributes[i++] = 1;
00218         attributes[i++] = GLX_BLUE_SIZE;  attributes[i++] = 1;
00219         attributes[i++] = GLX_GREEN_SIZE; attributes[i++] = 1;
00220         attributes[i++] = GLX_DEPTH_SIZE; attributes[i++] = 1;
00221         /* GLX >= 1.4 required for multi-sample */
00222         if(samples && (glxVersionMajor >= 1) && (glxVersionMinor >= 4)) {
00223             attributes[i++] = GLX_SAMPLE_BUFFERS; attributes[i++] = 1;
00224             attributes[i++] = GLX_SAMPLES; attributes[i++] = samples;
00225         }
00226         attributes[i] = None;
00227 
00228         m_visual = glXChooseVisual(m_display, DefaultScreen(m_display), attributes);
00229 
00230         /* Any sample level or even zero, which means oversampling disabled, is good
00231            but we need a valid visual to continue */
00232         if (m_visual == NULL) {
00233             if (samples == 0) {
00234                 /* All options exhausted, cannot continue */
00235                 printf("%s:%d: X11 glXChooseVisual() failed, verify working openGL system!\n", __FILE__, __LINE__);
00236                 
00237                 if(s_firstContext==NULL) {
00238                     printf("initial window could not find the GLX extension, exit!\n");
00239                     exit(1);
00240                 }
00241                 
00242                 return;
00243             }
00244         } else {
00245             if (m_numOfAASamples && (m_numOfAASamples > samples)) {
00246                 printf("%s:%d: oversampling requested %i but using %i samples\n",
00247                        __FILE__, __LINE__, m_numOfAASamples, samples);
00248             }
00249             break;
00250         }
00251     }
00252 
00253     // Create a bunch of attributes needed to create an X window.
00254 
00255 
00256     // First create a colormap for the window and visual. 
00257     // This seems pretty much a legacy feature as we are in rgba mode anyway.
00258 
00259     XSetWindowAttributes xattributes;
00260     memset(&xattributes, 0, sizeof(xattributes));
00261 
00262     xattributes.colormap= XCreateColormap(
00263         m_display, 
00264         RootWindow(m_display, m_visual->screen),
00265         m_visual->visual,
00266         AllocNone
00267     );
00268 
00269     xattributes.border_pixel= 0;
00270 
00271     // Specify which events we are interested in hearing.   
00272 
00273     xattributes.event_mask= 
00274         ExposureMask | StructureNotifyMask | 
00275         KeyPressMask | KeyReleaseMask |
00276         EnterWindowMask | LeaveWindowMask |
00277         ButtonPressMask | ButtonReleaseMask |
00278         PointerMotionMask | FocusChangeMask | PropertyChangeMask;
00279 
00280     // create the window!
00281 
00282     ;
00283     if (parentWindow == 0) {
00284         m_window = 
00285             XCreateWindow(
00286                 m_display, 
00287                 RootWindow(m_display, m_visual->screen), 
00288                 left,
00289                 top,
00290                 width,
00291                 height,
00292                 0, // no border.
00293                 m_visual->depth,
00294                 InputOutput, 
00295                 m_visual->visual,
00296                 CWBorderPixel|CWColormap|CWEventMask, 
00297                 &xattributes
00298             );
00299     } else {
00300 
00301         Window root_return;
00302         int x_return,y_return;
00303         unsigned int w_return,h_return,border_w_return,depth_return;
00304         
00305         XGetGeometry(m_display, parentWindow, &root_return, &x_return, &y_return,
00306             &w_return, &h_return, &border_w_return, &depth_return );
00307 
00308         left = 0;
00309         top = 0;
00310         width = w_return;
00311         height = h_return;
00312 
00313 
00314         m_window = XCreateWindow(
00315                 m_display, 
00316                 parentWindow,  // reparent against embedder 
00317                 left,
00318                 top,
00319                 width,
00320                 height,
00321                 0, // no border.
00322                 m_visual->depth,
00323                 InputOutput, 
00324                 m_visual->visual,
00325                 CWBorderPixel|CWColormap|CWEventMask, 
00326                 &xattributes
00327             );
00328 
00329         XSelectInput(m_display , parentWindow, SubstructureNotifyMask);
00330         
00331     }   
00332 
00333 #ifdef WITH_XDND
00334     /* initialize drop target for newly created window */
00335     m_dropTarget = new GHOST_DropTargetX11(this, m_system);
00336     GHOST_PRINT("Set drop target\n");
00337 #endif
00338 
00339     /*
00340      * One of the problem with WM-spec is that can't set a property
00341      * to a window that isn't mapped. That is why we can't "just
00342      * call setState" here.
00343      *
00344      * To fix this, we first need know that the window is really
00345      * map waiting for the MapNotify event.
00346      *
00347      * So, m_post_init indicate that we need wait for the MapNotify
00348      * event and then set the Window state to the m_post_state.
00349      */
00350     if ((state != GHOST_kWindowStateNormal) && (state != GHOST_kWindowStateMinimized)) {
00351         m_post_init = True;
00352         m_post_state = state;
00353     }
00354     else {
00355         m_post_init = False;
00356         m_post_state = GHOST_kWindowStateNormal;
00357     }
00358     
00359     // Create some hints for the window manager on how
00360     // we want this window treated.
00361 
00362     XSizeHints * xsizehints = XAllocSizeHints();
00363     xsizehints->flags = PPosition | PSize | PMinSize | PMaxSize;
00364     xsizehints->x = left;
00365     xsizehints->y = top;
00366     xsizehints->width = width;
00367     xsizehints->height = height;
00368     xsizehints->min_width= 320;     // size hints, could be made apart of the ghost api
00369     xsizehints->min_height= 240;    // limits are also arbitrary, but should not allow 1x1 window
00370     xsizehints->max_width= 65535;
00371     xsizehints->max_height= 65535;
00372     XSetWMNormalHints(m_display, m_window, xsizehints);
00373     XFree(xsizehints);
00374 
00375     XClassHint * xclasshint = XAllocClassHint();
00376     const int len = title.Length() + 1;
00377     char *wmclass = (char *)malloc(sizeof(char) * len);
00378     strncpy(wmclass, (const char*)title, sizeof(char) * len);
00379     xclasshint->res_name = wmclass;
00380     xclasshint->res_class = wmclass;
00381     XSetClassHint(m_display, m_window, xclasshint);
00382     free(wmclass);
00383     XFree(xclasshint);
00384 
00385     /* The basic for a good ICCCM "work" */
00386     if (m_system->m_wm_protocols) {
00387         natom= 0;
00388 
00389         if (m_system->m_delete_window_atom) {
00390             atoms[natom]= m_system->m_delete_window_atom;
00391             natom++;
00392         }
00393 
00394         if (m_system->m_wm_take_focus) {
00395             atoms[natom]= m_system->m_wm_take_focus;
00396             natom++;
00397         }
00398 
00399         if (natom) {
00400             /* printf("Register atoms: %d\n", natom); */
00401             XSetWMProtocols(m_display, m_window, atoms, natom);
00402         }
00403     }
00404 
00405 #if defined(WITH_X11_XINPUT) && defined(X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING)
00406     m_xic = XCreateIC(m_system->getX11_XIM(), XNClientWindow, m_window, XNFocusWindow, m_window,
00407                       XNInputStyle, XIMPreeditNothing | XIMStatusNothing,
00408                       XNResourceName, GHOST_X11_RES_NAME, XNResourceClass,
00409                       GHOST_X11_RES_CLASS, NULL);
00410 #endif
00411 
00412     // Set the window icon
00413     XWMHints *xwmhints = XAllocWMHints();
00414     XImage *x_image, *mask_image;
00415     Pixmap icon_pixmap, mask_pixmap;
00416     icon_pixmap = XCreatePixmap(display, m_window, BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH, BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT, 24);
00417     mask_pixmap = XCreatePixmap(display, m_window, BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH, BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT, 1);
00418     GC gc_icon = XCreateGC(display, icon_pixmap, 0, NULL);
00419     GC gc_mask = XCreateGC(display, mask_pixmap, 0, NULL);
00420     
00421     x_image = XCreateImage( display, m_visual->visual, 24, ZPixmap, 0, NULL, BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH, BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT, 32, 0 );
00422     mask_image = XCreateImage( display, m_visual->visual, 1, ZPixmap, 0, NULL,  BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH, BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT, 8, 0);
00423     
00424     x_image->data = (char *)malloc(x_image->bytes_per_line * BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT);
00425     mask_image->data = (char *)malloc( mask_image->bytes_per_line * BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT);
00426     
00427     /* copy the BLENDER_ICON_48x48x24 into the XImage */
00428     unsigned char *col = BLENDER_ICON_48x48x24;
00429     int px, py;
00430     for (px=0; px<BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH; px++) {
00431         for (py=0; py<BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT; py++, col+=3) {
00432             /* mask out pink */
00433             if (col[0]==255 && col[1] == 0 && col[2]== 255) {
00434                 XPutPixel(mask_image, px, py, 0 );
00435             } else {
00436                 XPutPixel(x_image, px, py, (col[0]<<16)+(col[1]<<8)+col[2] );
00437                 XPutPixel(mask_image, px, py, 1 );
00438             }
00439         }
00440     }
00441     
00442     XPutImage(display, icon_pixmap, gc_icon, x_image, 0, 0, 0, 0, BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH, BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT);
00443     XPutImage(display, mask_pixmap, gc_mask, mask_image, 0, 0, 0, 0, BLENDER_ICON_WIDTH, BLENDER_ICON_HEIGHT);
00444     
00445     // Now the pixmap is ok to assign to the window as a hint
00446     xwmhints->icon_pixmap = icon_pixmap;
00447     xwmhints->icon_mask = mask_pixmap;
00448     XFreeGC (display, gc_icon);
00449     XFreeGC (display, gc_mask);
00450     XDestroyImage( x_image ); /* frees x_image->data too */
00451     XDestroyImage( mask_image );
00452     
00453     xwmhints->initial_state = NormalState;
00454     xwmhints->input= True;
00455     xwmhints->flags= InputHint|IconPixmapHint|IconMaskHint|StateHint;
00456     XSetWMHints(display, m_window, xwmhints );
00457     XFree(xwmhints);
00458     // done setting the icon
00459 
00460     setTitle(title);
00461 
00462 #ifdef WITH_X11_XINPUT
00463     initXInputDevices();
00464 #endif
00465 
00466     // now set up the rendering context.
00467     if (installDrawingContext(type) == GHOST_kSuccess) {
00468         m_valid_setup = true;
00469         GHOST_PRINT("Created window\n");
00470     }
00471 
00472     XMapWindow(m_display, m_window);
00473     GHOST_PRINT("Mapped window\n");
00474 
00475     XFlush(m_display);
00476 }
00477 
00478 #ifdef WITH_X11_XINPUT
00479 /* 
00480     Dummy function to get around IO Handler exiting if device invalid
00481     Basically it will not crash blender now if you have a X device that 
00482     is configured but not plugged in.
00483 
00484 */
00485 static int ApplicationErrorHandler(Display *display, XErrorEvent *theEvent)
00486 {
00487     fprintf(stderr, "Ignoring Xlib error: error code %d request code %d\n",
00488         theEvent->error_code, theEvent->request_code);
00489 
00490     /* No exit! - but keep lint happy */
00491     return 0;
00492 }
00493 
00494 /* These C functions are copied from Wine 1.1.13's wintab.c */
00495 #define BOOL int
00496 #define TRUE 1
00497 #define FALSE 0
00498 
00499 static bool match_token(const char *haystack, const char *needle)
00500 {
00501     const char *p, *q;
00502     for (p = haystack; *p; )
00503     {
00504         while (*p && isspace(*p))
00505             p++;
00506         if (! *p)
00507             break;
00508 
00509         for (q = needle; *q && *p && tolower(*p) == tolower(*q); q++)
00510             p++;
00511         if (! *q && (isspace(*p) || !*p))
00512             return TRUE;
00513 
00514         while (*p && ! isspace(*p))
00515             p++;
00516     }
00517     return FALSE;
00518 }
00519 
00520 
00521 /*  Determining if an X device is a Tablet style device is an imperfect science.
00522 **  We rely on common conventions around device names as well as the type reported
00523 **  by Wacom tablets.  This code will likely need to be expanded for alternate tablet types
00524 **
00525 **  Wintab refers to any device that interacts with the tablet as a cursor,
00526 **  (stylus, eraser, tablet mouse, airbrush, etc)
00527 **  this is not to be confused with wacom x11 configuration "cursor" device.
00528 **  Wacoms x11 config "cursor" refers to its device slot (which we mirror with
00529 **  our gSysCursors) for puck like devices (tablet mice essentially).
00530 */
00531 #if 0 // unused
00532 static BOOL is_tablet_cursor(const char *name, const char *type)
00533 {
00534     int i;
00535     static const char *tablet_cursor_whitelist[] = {
00536         "wacom",
00537         "wizardpen",
00538         "acecad",
00539         "tablet",
00540         "cursor",
00541         "stylus",
00542         "eraser",
00543         "pad",
00544         NULL
00545     };
00546 
00547     for (i=0; tablet_cursor_whitelist[i] != NULL; i++) {
00548         if (name && match_token(name, tablet_cursor_whitelist[i]))
00549             return TRUE;
00550         if (type && match_token(type, tablet_cursor_whitelist[i]))
00551             return TRUE;
00552     }
00553     return FALSE;
00554 }
00555 #endif
00556 static BOOL is_stylus(const char *name, const char *type)
00557 {
00558     int i;
00559     static const char* tablet_stylus_whitelist[] = {
00560         "stylus",
00561         "wizardpen",
00562         "acecad",
00563         NULL
00564     };
00565 
00566     for (i=0; tablet_stylus_whitelist[i] != NULL; i++) {
00567         if (name && match_token(name, tablet_stylus_whitelist[i]))
00568             return TRUE;
00569         if (type && match_token(type, tablet_stylus_whitelist[i]))
00570             return TRUE;
00571     }
00572 
00573     return FALSE;
00574 }
00575 
00576 static BOOL is_eraser(const char *name, const char *type)
00577 {
00578     if (name && match_token(name, "eraser"))
00579         return TRUE;
00580     if (type && match_token(type, "eraser"))
00581         return TRUE;
00582     return FALSE;
00583 }
00584 #undef BOOL
00585 #undef TRUE
00586 #undef FALSE
00587 /* end code copied from wine */
00588 
00589 void GHOST_WindowX11::initXInputDevices()
00590 {
00591     static XErrorHandler old_handler = (XErrorHandler) 0;
00592     XExtensionVersion *version = XGetExtensionVersion(m_display, INAME);
00593 
00594     if(version && (version != (XExtensionVersion*)NoSuchExtension)) {
00595         if(version->present) {
00596             int device_count;
00597             XDeviceInfo* device_info = XListInputDevices(m_display, &device_count);
00598             m_xtablet.StylusDevice = NULL;
00599             m_xtablet.EraserDevice = NULL;
00600             m_xtablet.CommonData.Active= GHOST_kTabletModeNone;
00601 
00602             /* Install our error handler to override Xlib's termination behavior */
00603             old_handler = XSetErrorHandler(ApplicationErrorHandler);
00604 
00605             for(int i=0; i<device_count; ++i) {
00606                 char *device_type = device_info[i].type ? XGetAtomName(m_display, device_info[i].type) : NULL;
00607                 
00608 //              printf("Tablet type:'%s', name:'%s', index:%d\n", device_type, device_info[i].name, i);
00609 
00610 
00611                 if(m_xtablet.StylusDevice==NULL && is_stylus(device_info[i].name, device_type)) {
00612 //                  printf("\tfound stylus\n");
00613                     m_xtablet.StylusID= device_info[i].id;
00614                     m_xtablet.StylusDevice = XOpenDevice(m_display, m_xtablet.StylusID);
00615 
00616                     if (m_xtablet.StylusDevice != NULL) {
00617                         /* Find how many pressure levels tablet has */
00618                         XAnyClassPtr ici = device_info[i].inputclassinfo;
00619                         for(int j=0; j<m_xtablet.StylusDevice->num_classes; ++j) {
00620                             if(ici->c_class==ValuatorClass) {
00621 //                              printf("\t\tfound ValuatorClass\n");
00622                                 XValuatorInfo* xvi = (XValuatorInfo*)ici;
00623                                 m_xtablet.PressureLevels = xvi->axes[2].max_value;
00624                             
00625                                 /* this is assuming that the tablet has the same tilt resolution in both
00626                                  * positive and negative directions. It would be rather weird if it didn't.. */
00627                                 m_xtablet.XtiltLevels = xvi->axes[3].max_value;
00628                                 m_xtablet.YtiltLevels = xvi->axes[4].max_value;
00629                                 break;
00630                             }
00631                         
00632                             ici = (XAnyClassPtr)(((char *)ici) + ici->length);
00633                         }
00634                     } else {
00635                         m_xtablet.StylusID= 0;
00636                     }
00637                 }
00638                 else if(m_xtablet.EraserDevice==NULL && is_eraser(device_info[i].name, device_type)) {
00639 //                  printf("\tfound eraser\n");
00640                     m_xtablet.EraserID= device_info[i].id;
00641                     m_xtablet.EraserDevice = XOpenDevice(m_display, m_xtablet.EraserID);
00642                     if (m_xtablet.EraserDevice == NULL) m_xtablet.EraserID= 0;
00643                 }
00644 
00645                 if(device_type) {
00646                     XFree((void*)device_type);
00647                 }
00648             }
00649 
00650             /* Restore handler */
00651             (void) XSetErrorHandler(old_handler);
00652 
00653             XFreeDeviceList(device_info);
00654 
00655 
00656             XEventClass xevents[10], ev;
00657             int dcount = 0;
00658 
00659             if(m_xtablet.StylusDevice) {
00660                 DeviceMotionNotify(m_xtablet.StylusDevice, m_xtablet.MotionEvent, ev);
00661                 if(ev) xevents[dcount++] = ev;
00662                 ProximityIn(m_xtablet.StylusDevice, m_xtablet.ProxInEvent, ev);
00663                 if(ev) xevents[dcount++] = ev;
00664                 ProximityOut(m_xtablet.StylusDevice, m_xtablet.ProxOutEvent, ev);
00665                 if(ev) xevents[dcount++] = ev;
00666             }
00667             if(m_xtablet.EraserDevice) {
00668                 DeviceMotionNotify(m_xtablet.EraserDevice, m_xtablet.MotionEvent, ev);
00669                 if(ev) xevents[dcount++] = ev;
00670                 ProximityIn(m_xtablet.EraserDevice, m_xtablet.ProxInEvent, ev);
00671                 if(ev) xevents[dcount++] = ev;
00672                 ProximityOut(m_xtablet.EraserDevice, m_xtablet.ProxOutEvent, ev);
00673                 if(ev) xevents[dcount++] = ev;
00674             }
00675 
00676             XSelectExtensionEvent(m_display, m_window, xevents, dcount);
00677         }
00678         XFree(version);
00679     }
00680 }
00681 
00682 #endif /* WITH_X11_XINPUT */

00698     void 
00699 GHOST_WindowX11::
00700 setTitle(
00701     const STR_String& title
00702 ){
00703     Atom name = XInternAtom(m_display, "_NET_WM_NAME", 0);
00704     Atom utf8str = XInternAtom(m_display, "UTF8_STRING", 0);
00705     XChangeProperty(m_display, m_window,
00706                     name, utf8str, 8, PropModeReplace,
00707                     (const unsigned char*) title.ReadPtr(),
00708                     title.Length());
00709 
00710 // This should convert to valid x11 string
00711 //  and getTitle would need matching change
00712     XStoreName(m_display,m_window,title);
00713 
00714     XFlush(m_display);
00715 }
00716 
00717     void 
00718 GHOST_WindowX11::
00719 getTitle(
00720     STR_String& title
00721 ) const {
00722     char *name = NULL;
00723     
00724     XFetchName(m_display,m_window,&name);
00725     title= name?name:"untitled";
00726     XFree(name);
00727 }

00729     void 
00730 GHOST_WindowX11::
00731 getWindowBounds(
00732     GHOST_Rect& bounds
00733 ) const {
00734         // Getting the window bounds under X11 is not
00735         // really supported (nor should it be desired).
00736     getClientBounds(bounds);
00737 }
00738 
00739     void 
00740 GHOST_WindowX11::
00741 getClientBounds(
00742     GHOST_Rect& bounds
00743 ) const {
00744     Window root_return;
00745     int x_return,y_return;
00746     unsigned int w_return,h_return,border_w_return,depth_return;
00747     GHOST_TInt32 screen_x, screen_y;
00748     
00749     XGetGeometry(m_display,m_window,&root_return,&x_return,&y_return,
00750         &w_return,&h_return,&border_w_return,&depth_return);
00751 
00752     clientToScreen(0, 0, screen_x, screen_y);
00753     
00754     bounds.m_l = screen_x;
00755     bounds.m_r = bounds.m_l + w_return;
00756     bounds.m_t = screen_y;
00757     bounds.m_b = bounds.m_t + h_return;
00758 
00759 }

00762 GHOST_WindowX11::
00763 setClientWidth(
00764     GHOST_TUns32 width
00765 ){  
00766     XWindowChanges values;
00767     unsigned int value_mask= CWWidth;       
00768     values.width = width;
00769     XConfigureWindow(m_display,m_window,value_mask,&values);
00770 
00771     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00772 }
00773 
00774     GHOST_TSuccess 
00775 GHOST_WindowX11::
00776 setClientHeight(
00777     GHOST_TUns32 height
00778 ){

00780     unsigned int value_mask= CWHeight;      
00781     values.height = height;
00782     XConfigureWindow(m_display,m_window,value_mask,&values);
00783     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00784 
00785 }
00786 
00787     GHOST_TSuccess 
00788 GHOST_WindowX11::
00789 setClientSize(
00790     GHOST_TUns32 width,
00791     GHOST_TUns32 height
00792 ){
00793     XWindowChanges values;
00794     unsigned int value_mask= CWWidth | CWHeight;        
00795     values.width = width;
00796     values.height = height;
00797     XConfigureWindow(m_display,m_window,value_mask,&values);
00798     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00799 
00800 }

00802     void 
00803 GHOST_WindowX11::
00804 screenToClient(
00805     GHOST_TInt32 inX,
00806     GHOST_TInt32 inY,
00807     GHOST_TInt32& outX,
00808     GHOST_TInt32& outY
00809 ) const {
00810     // This is correct!
00811 
00812     int ax,ay;
00813     Window temp;
00814 
00815     XTranslateCoordinates(
00816             m_display,
00817             RootWindow(m_display, m_visual->screen),
00818             m_window,
00819             inX,
00820             inY,
00821             &ax,
00822             &ay,
00823             &temp
00824         );
00825     outX = ax;
00826     outY = ay;
00827 }
00828          
00829     void 
00830 GHOST_WindowX11::
00831 clientToScreen(
00832     GHOST_TInt32 inX,
00833     GHOST_TInt32 inY,
00834     GHOST_TInt32& outX,
00835     GHOST_TInt32& outY
00836 ) const {
00837     int ax,ay;
00838     Window temp;
00839 
00840     XTranslateCoordinates(
00841             m_display,
00842             m_window,
00843             RootWindow(m_display, m_visual->screen),
00844             inX,
00845             inY,
00846             &ax,
00847             &ay,
00848             &temp
00849         );
00850     outX = ax;
00851     outY = ay;
00852 }
00853 
00854 void GHOST_WindowX11::icccmSetState(int state)
00855 {
00856     XEvent xev;
00857 
00858     if (state != IconicState)
00859         return;
00860 
00861     xev.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
00862     xev.xclient.serial = 0;
00863     xev.xclient.send_event = True;
00864     xev.xclient.display = m_display;
00865     xev.xclient.window = m_window;
00866     xev.xclient.format = 32;
00867     xev.xclient.message_type = m_system->m_wm_change_state;
00868     xev.xclient.data.l[0] = state;
00869     XSendEvent (m_display, RootWindow(m_display, DefaultScreen(m_display)),
00870         False, SubstructureNotifyMask | SubstructureRedirectMask, &xev);
00871 }
00872 
00873 int GHOST_WindowX11::icccmGetState(void) const
00874 {
00875     unsigned char *prop_ret;
00876     unsigned long bytes_after, num_ret;
00877     Atom type_ret;
00878     int format_ret, st;
00879 
00880     prop_ret = NULL;
00881     st = XGetWindowProperty(m_display, m_window, m_system->m_wm_state, 0,
00882             0x7fffffff, False, m_system->m_wm_state, &type_ret,
00883             &format_ret, &num_ret, &bytes_after, &prop_ret);
00884 
00885     if ((st == Success) && (prop_ret) && (num_ret == 2))
00886         st = prop_ret[0];
00887     else
00888         st = NormalState;
00889 
00890     if (prop_ret)
00891         XFree(prop_ret);
00892     return (st);
00893 }
00894 
00895 void GHOST_WindowX11::netwmMaximized(bool set)
00896 {
00897     XEvent xev;
00898 
00899     xev.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
00900     xev.xclient.serial = 0;
00901     xev.xclient.send_event = True;
00902     xev.xclient.window = m_window;
00903     xev.xclient.message_type = m_system->m_net_state;
00904     xev.xclient.format = 32;
00905 
00906     if (set == True)
00907         xev.xclient.data.l[0] = _NET_WM_STATE_ADD;
00908     else
00909         xev.xclient.data.l[0] = _NET_WM_STATE_REMOVE;
00910 
00911     xev.xclient.data.l[1] = m_system->m_net_max_horz;
00912     xev.xclient.data.l[2] = m_system->m_net_max_vert;
00913     xev.xclient.data.l[3] = 0;
00914     xev.xclient.data.l[4] = 0;
00915     XSendEvent(m_display, RootWindow(m_display, DefaultScreen(m_display)),
00916         False, SubstructureRedirectMask | SubstructureNotifyMask, &xev);
00917 }
00918 
00919 bool GHOST_WindowX11::netwmIsMaximized(void) const
00920 {
00921     unsigned char *prop_ret;
00922     unsigned long bytes_after, num_ret, i;
00923     Atom type_ret;
00924     bool st;
00925     int format_ret, ret, count;
00926 
00927     prop_ret = NULL;
00928     st = False;
00929     ret = XGetWindowProperty(m_display, m_window, m_system->m_net_state, 0,
00930             0x7fffffff, False, XA_ATOM, &type_ret, &format_ret,
00931             &num_ret, &bytes_after, &prop_ret);
00932     if ((ret == Success) && (prop_ret) && (format_ret == 32)) {
00933         count = 0;
00934         for (i = 0; i < num_ret; i++) {
00935             if (((unsigned long *) prop_ret)[i] == m_system->m_net_max_horz)
00936                 count++;
00937             if (((unsigned long *) prop_ret)[i] == m_system->m_net_max_vert)
00938                 count++;
00939             if (count == 2) {
00940                 st = True;
00941                 break;
00942             }
00943         }
00944     }
00945 
00946     if (prop_ret)
00947         XFree(prop_ret);
00948     return (st);
00949 }
00950 
00951 void GHOST_WindowX11::netwmFullScreen(bool set)
00952 {
00953     XEvent xev;
00954 
00955     xev.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
00956     xev.xclient.serial = 0;
00957     xev.xclient.send_event = True;
00958     xev.xclient.window = m_window;
00959     xev.xclient.message_type = m_system->m_net_state;
00960     xev.xclient.format = 32;
00961 
00962     if (set == True)
00963         xev.xclient.data.l[0] = _NET_WM_STATE_ADD;
00964     else
00965         xev.xclient.data.l[0] = _NET_WM_STATE_REMOVE;
00966 
00967     xev.xclient.data.l[1] = m_system->m_net_fullscreen;
00968     xev.xclient.data.l[2] = 0;
00969     xev.xclient.data.l[3] = 0;
00970     xev.xclient.data.l[4] = 0;
00971     XSendEvent(m_display, RootWindow(m_display, DefaultScreen(m_display)),
00972         False, SubstructureRedirectMask | SubstructureNotifyMask, &xev);
00973 }
00974 
00975 bool GHOST_WindowX11::netwmIsFullScreen(void) const
00976 {
00977     unsigned char *prop_ret;
00978     unsigned long bytes_after, num_ret, i;
00979     Atom type_ret;
00980     bool st;
00981     int format_ret, ret;
00982 
00983     prop_ret = NULL;
00984     st = False;
00985     ret = XGetWindowProperty(m_display, m_window, m_system->m_net_state, 0,
00986             0x7fffffff, False, XA_ATOM, &type_ret, &format_ret,
00987             &num_ret, &bytes_after, &prop_ret);
00988     if ((ret == Success) && (prop_ret) && (format_ret == 32)) {
00989         for (i = 0; i < num_ret; i++) {
00990             if (((unsigned long *) prop_ret)[i] == m_system->m_net_fullscreen) {
00991                 st = True;
00992                 break;
00993             }
00994         }
00995     }
00996 
00997     if (prop_ret)
00998         XFree(prop_ret);
00999     return (st);
01000 }
01001 
01002 void GHOST_WindowX11::motifFullScreen(bool set)
01003 {
01004     MotifWmHints hints;
01005 
01006     hints.flags = MWM_HINTS_DECORATIONS;
01007     if (set == True)
01008         hints.decorations = 0;
01009     else
01010         hints.decorations = 1;
01011 
01012     XChangeProperty(m_display, m_window, m_system->m_motif,
01013             m_system->m_motif, 32, PropModeReplace,
01014             (unsigned char *) &hints, 4);
01015 }
01016 
01017 bool GHOST_WindowX11::motifIsFullScreen(void) const
01018 {
01019     unsigned char *prop_ret;
01020     unsigned long bytes_after, num_ret;
01021     MotifWmHints *hints;
01022     Atom type_ret;
01023     bool state;
01024     int format_ret, st;
01025 
01026     prop_ret = NULL;
01027     state = False;
01028     st = XGetWindowProperty(m_display, m_window, m_system->m_motif, 0,
01029                 0x7fffffff, False, m_system->m_motif,
01030                 &type_ret, &format_ret, &num_ret,
01031                 &bytes_after, &prop_ret);
01032     if ((st == Success) && (prop_ret)) {
01033         hints = (MotifWmHints *) prop_ret;
01034         if (hints->flags & MWM_HINTS_DECORATIONS) {
01035             if (!hints->decorations)
01036                 state = True;
01037         }
01038     }
01039 
01040     if (prop_ret)
01041         XFree(prop_ret);
01042     return (state);
01043 }
01044 
01045 GHOST_TWindowState GHOST_WindowX11::getState() const
01046 {
01047     GHOST_TWindowState state_ret;
01048     int state;
01049 
01050     state_ret = GHOST_kWindowStateNormal;
01051     state = icccmGetState();
01052     /*
01053      * In the Iconic and Withdrawn state, the window
01054      * is unmaped, so only need return a Minimized state.
01055      */
01056     if ((state == IconicState) || (state == WithdrawnState))
01057         state_ret = GHOST_kWindowStateMinimized;
01058     else if (netwmIsMaximized() == True)
01059         state_ret = GHOST_kWindowStateMaximized;
01060     else if (netwmIsFullScreen() == True)
01061         state_ret = GHOST_kWindowStateFullScreen;
01062     else if (motifIsFullScreen() == True)
01063         state_ret = GHOST_kWindowStateFullScreen;
01064     return (state_ret);
01065 }
01066 
01067 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_WindowX11::setState(GHOST_TWindowState state)
01068 {
01069     GHOST_TWindowState cur_state;
01070     bool is_max, is_full, is_motif_full;
01071 
01072     cur_state = getState();
01073         if (state == (int)cur_state)
01074         return GHOST_kSuccess;
01075 
01076     if (cur_state != GHOST_kWindowStateMinimized) {
01077         /*
01078          * The window don't have this property's
01079          * if it's not mapped.
01080          */
01081         is_max = netwmIsMaximized();
01082         is_full = netwmIsFullScreen();
01083     }
01084     else {
01085         is_max = False;
01086         is_full = False;
01087     }
01088 
01089     is_motif_full = motifIsFullScreen();
01090 
01091     if (state == GHOST_kWindowStateNormal)
01092         state = m_normal_state;
01093 
01094     if (state == GHOST_kWindowStateNormal) {
01095         if (is_max == True)
01096             netwmMaximized(False);
01097         if (is_full == True)
01098             netwmFullScreen(False);
01099         if (is_motif_full == True)
01100             motifFullScreen(False);
01101         icccmSetState(NormalState);
01102         return (GHOST_kSuccess);
01103     }
01104 
01105     if (state == GHOST_kWindowStateFullScreen) {
01106         /*
01107          * We can't change to full screen if the window
01108          * isn't mapped.
01109          */
01110         if (cur_state == GHOST_kWindowStateMinimized)
01111             return (GHOST_kFailure);
01112 
01113         m_normal_state = cur_state;
01114 
01115         if (is_max == True)
01116             netwmMaximized(False);
01117         if (is_full == False)
01118             netwmFullScreen(True);
01119         if (is_motif_full == False)
01120             motifFullScreen(True);
01121         return (GHOST_kSuccess);
01122     }
01123 
01124     if (state == GHOST_kWindowStateMaximized) {
01125         /*
01126          * We can't change to Maximized if the window
01127          * isn't mapped.
01128          */
01129         if (cur_state == GHOST_kWindowStateMinimized)
01130             return (GHOST_kFailure);
01131 
01132         if (is_full == True)
01133             netwmFullScreen(False);
01134         if (is_motif_full == True)
01135             motifFullScreen(False);
01136         if (is_max == False)
01137             netwmMaximized(True);
01138         return (GHOST_kSuccess);
01139     }
01140 
01141     if (state == GHOST_kWindowStateMinimized) {
01142         /*
01143          * The window manager need save the current state of
01144          * the window (maximized, full screen, etc).
01145          */
01146         icccmSetState(IconicState);
01147         return (GHOST_kSuccess);
01148     }
01149 
01150     return (GHOST_kFailure);
01151 }
01152 
01153 #include <iostream>
01154 using namespace std;
01155 
01156     GHOST_TSuccess 
01157 GHOST_WindowX11::
01158 setOrder(
01159     GHOST_TWindowOrder order
01160 ){
01161     if (order == GHOST_kWindowOrderTop) {
01162         XWindowAttributes attr;   
01163         Atom atom;
01164 
01165         /* We use both XRaiseWindow and _NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW, since some
01166            window managers ignore the former (e.g. kwin from kde) and others
01167            don't implement the latter (e.g. fluxbox pre 0.9.9) */
01168 
01169         XRaiseWindow(m_display, m_window);
01170 
01171         atom = XInternAtom(m_display, "_NET_ACTIVE_WINDOW", True);
01172 
01173         if (atom != None) {
01174             Window root;
01175             XEvent xev;
01176             long eventmask;
01177 
01178             xev.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
01179             xev.xclient.serial = 0;
01180             xev.xclient.send_event = True;
01181             xev.xclient.window = m_window;
01182             xev.xclient.message_type = atom;
01183 
01184             xev.xclient.format = 32;
01185             xev.xclient.data.l[0] = 1;
01186             xev.xclient.data.l[1] = CurrentTime;
01187             xev.xclient.data.l[2] = m_window;
01188             xev.xclient.data.l[3] = 0;
01189             xev.xclient.data.l[4] = 0;
01190 
01191             root = RootWindow(m_display, m_visual->screen),
01192             eventmask = SubstructureRedirectMask | SubstructureNotifyMask;
01193 
01194             XSendEvent(m_display, root, False, eventmask, &xev);
01195         }
01196 
01197         XGetWindowAttributes(m_display, m_window, &attr);
01198 
01199         /* iconized windows give bad match error */
01200         if (attr.map_state == IsViewable)
01201             XSetInputFocus(m_display, m_window, RevertToPointerRoot,
01202                          CurrentTime);
01203         XFlush(m_display);
01204     } else if (order == GHOST_kWindowOrderBottom) {
01205         XLowerWindow(m_display,m_window);
01206         XFlush(m_display);
01207     } else {
01208         return GHOST_kFailure;
01209     }
01210     
01211     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01212 }
01213 
01214     GHOST_TSuccess 
01215 GHOST_WindowX11::
01216 swapBuffers(
01217 ){
01218     if (getDrawingContextType() == GHOST_kDrawingContextTypeOpenGL) {
01219         glXSwapBuffers(m_display,m_window);
01220         return GHOST_kSuccess;
01221     } else {
01222         return GHOST_kFailure;
01223     }
01224 }
01225 
01226     GHOST_TSuccess 
01227 GHOST_WindowX11::
01228 activateDrawingContext(
01229 ){
01230     if (m_context !=NULL) {
01231         glXMakeCurrent(m_display, m_window,m_context);                      
01232         return GHOST_kSuccess;
01233     } 
01234     return GHOST_kFailure;
01235 }
01236 
01237     GHOST_TSuccess
01238 GHOST_WindowX11::
01239 invalidate(
01240 ){
01241 
01242     // So the idea of this function is to generate an expose event
01243     // for the window.
01244     // Unfortunately X does not handle expose events for you and 
01245     // it is the client's job to refresh the dirty part of the window.
01246     // We need to queue up invalidate calls and generate GHOST events 
01247     // for them in the system.
01248 
01249     // We implement this by setting a boolean in this class to concatenate 
01250     // all such calls into a single event for this window.
01251 
01252     // At the same time we queue the dirty windows in the system class
01253     // and generate events for them at the next processEvents call.
01254 
01255     if (m_invalid_window == false) {
01256         m_system->addDirtyWindow(this);
01257         m_invalid_window = true;
01258     } 
01259  
01260     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01261 }
01262 
01268     void
01269 GHOST_WindowX11::
01270 validate(
01271 ){
01272     m_invalid_window = false;
01273 }   
01274  
01275  
01281 GHOST_WindowX11::
01282 ~GHOST_WindowX11(
01283 ){
01284     static Atom Primary_atom, Clipboard_atom;
01285     Window p_owner, c_owner;
01286     /*Change the owner of the Atoms to None if we are the owner*/
01287     Primary_atom = XInternAtom(m_display, "PRIMARY", False);
01288     Clipboard_atom = XInternAtom(m_display, "CLIPBOARD", False);
01289     
01290     p_owner = XGetSelectionOwner(m_display, Primary_atom);
01291     c_owner = XGetSelectionOwner(m_display, Clipboard_atom);
01292     
01293     std::map<unsigned int, Cursor>::iterator it = m_standard_cursors.begin();
01294     for (; it != m_standard_cursors.end(); it++) {
01295         XFreeCursor(m_display, it->second);
01296     }
01297 
01298     if (m_empty_cursor) {
01299         XFreeCursor(m_display, m_empty_cursor);
01300     }
01301     if (m_custom_cursor) {
01302         XFreeCursor(m_display, m_custom_cursor);
01303     }
01304 
01305 #ifdef WITH_X11_XINPUT
01306     /* close tablet devices */
01307     if(m_xtablet.StylusDevice)
01308         XCloseDevice(m_display, m_xtablet.StylusDevice);
01309     
01310     if(m_xtablet.EraserDevice)
01311         XCloseDevice(m_display, m_xtablet.EraserDevice);
01312 #endif /* WITH_X11_XINPUT */
01313 
01314     if (m_context != s_firstContext) {
01315         glXDestroyContext(m_display, m_context);
01316     }
01317     
01318     if (p_owner == m_window) {
01319         XSetSelectionOwner(m_display, Primary_atom, None, CurrentTime);
01320     }
01321     if (c_owner == m_window) {
01322         XSetSelectionOwner(m_display, Clipboard_atom, None, CurrentTime);
01323     }
01324     
01325 #if defined(WITH_X11_XINPUT) && defined(X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING)
01326     if (m_xic) {
01327         XDestroyIC(m_xic);
01328     }
01329 #endif
01330 
01331 #ifdef WITH_XDND
01332     delete m_dropTarget;
01333 #endif
01334 
01335     XDestroyWindow(m_display, m_window);
01336     XFree(m_visual);
01337 }
01338 
01339 
01340 
01341 
01347     GHOST_TSuccess 
01348 GHOST_WindowX11::
01349 installDrawingContext(
01350     GHOST_TDrawingContextType type
01351 ){
01352     // only support openGL for now.
01353     GHOST_TSuccess success;
01354     switch (type) {
01355     case GHOST_kDrawingContextTypeOpenGL:
01356         m_context = glXCreateContext(m_display, m_visual, s_firstContext, True);
01357         if (m_context !=NULL) {
01358             if (!s_firstContext) {
01359                 s_firstContext = m_context;
01360             }
01361             glXMakeCurrent(m_display, m_window,m_context);
01362             glClearColor(0.447, 0.447, 0.447, 0);
01363             glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT);
01364             success = GHOST_kSuccess;
01365         } else {
01366             success = GHOST_kFailure;
01367         }
01368 
01369         break;
01370 
01371     case GHOST_kDrawingContextTypeNone:
01372         success = GHOST_kSuccess;
01373         break;
01374 
01375     default:
01376         success = GHOST_kFailure;
01377     }
01378     return success;
01379 }
01380 
01381 
01382 
01387     GHOST_TSuccess 
01388 GHOST_WindowX11::
01389 removeDrawingContext(
01390 ){
01391     GHOST_TSuccess success;
01392 
01393     if (m_context != NULL) {
01394         glXDestroyContext(m_display, m_context);
01395         success = GHOST_kSuccess;
01396     } else {
01397         success = GHOST_kFailure;
01398     }
01399     return success; 
01400 }
01401 
01402 
01403     Cursor
01404 GHOST_WindowX11::
01405 getStandardCursor(
01406     GHOST_TStandardCursor g_cursor
01407 ){
01408     unsigned int xcursor_id;
01409 
01410 #define GtoX(gcurs, xcurs)  case gcurs: xcursor_id = xcurs
01411     switch (g_cursor) {
01412     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorRightArrow, XC_arrow); break;
01413     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorLeftArrow, XC_top_left_arrow); break;
01414     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorInfo, XC_hand1); break;
01415     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorDestroy, XC_pirate); break;
01416     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorHelp, XC_question_arrow); break; 
01417     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorCycle, XC_exchange); break;
01418     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorSpray, XC_spraycan); break;
01419     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorWait, XC_watch); break;
01420     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorText, XC_xterm); break;
01421     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorCrosshair, XC_crosshair); break;
01422     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorUpDown, XC_sb_v_double_arrow); break;
01423     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorLeftRight, XC_sb_h_double_arrow); break;
01424     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorTopSide, XC_top_side); break;
01425     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorBottomSide, XC_bottom_side); break;
01426     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorLeftSide, XC_left_side); break;
01427     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorRightSide, XC_right_side); break;
01428     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorTopLeftCorner, XC_top_left_corner); break;
01429     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorTopRightCorner, XC_top_right_corner); break;
01430     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorBottomRightCorner, XC_bottom_right_corner); break;
01431     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorBottomLeftCorner, XC_bottom_left_corner); break;
01432     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorPencil, XC_pencil); break;
01433     GtoX(GHOST_kStandardCursorCopy, XC_arrow); break;
01434     default:
01435         xcursor_id = 0;
01436     }
01437 #undef GtoX
01438 
01439     if (xcursor_id) {
01440         Cursor xcursor = m_standard_cursors[xcursor_id];
01441         
01442         if (!xcursor) {
01443             xcursor = XCreateFontCursor(m_display, xcursor_id);
01444 
01445             m_standard_cursors[xcursor_id] = xcursor;
01446         }
01447         
01448         return xcursor;
01449     } else {
01450         return None;
01451     }
01452 }
01453 
01454     Cursor 
01455 GHOST_WindowX11::
01456 getEmptyCursor(
01457 ) {
01458     if (!m_empty_cursor) {
01459         Pixmap blank;
01460         XColor dummy;
01461         char data[1] = {0};
01462             
01463         /* make a blank cursor */
01464         blank = XCreateBitmapFromData (
01465             m_display, 
01466             RootWindow(m_display,DefaultScreen(m_display)),
01467             data, 1, 1
01468         );
01469 
01470         m_empty_cursor = XCreatePixmapCursor(m_display, blank, blank, &dummy, &dummy, 0, 0);
01471         XFreePixmap(m_display, blank);
01472     }
01473 
01474     return m_empty_cursor;
01475 }
01476 
01477     GHOST_TSuccess
01478 GHOST_WindowX11::
01479 setWindowCursorVisibility(
01480     bool visible
01481 ){
01482     Cursor xcursor;
01483     
01484     if (visible) {
01485         xcursor = getStandardCursor( getCursorShape() );
01486     } else {
01487         xcursor = getEmptyCursor();
01488     }
01489 
01490     XDefineCursor(m_display, m_window, xcursor);
01491     XFlush(m_display);
01492     
01493     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01494 }
01495 
01496     GHOST_TSuccess
01497 GHOST_WindowX11::
01498 setWindowCursorGrab(
01499     GHOST_TGrabCursorMode mode
01500 ){
01501     if(mode != GHOST_kGrabDisable) {
01502         if(mode != GHOST_kGrabNormal) {
01503             m_system->getCursorPosition(m_cursorGrabInitPos[0], m_cursorGrabInitPos[1]);
01504             setCursorGrabAccum(0, 0);
01505 
01506             if(mode == GHOST_kGrabHide)
01507                 setWindowCursorVisibility(false);
01508 
01509         }
01510 #ifdef GHOST_X11_GRAB
01511         XGrabPointer(m_display, m_window, False, ButtonPressMask | ButtonReleaseMask | PointerMotionMask,
01512                      GrabModeAsync, GrabModeAsync, None, None, CurrentTime);
01513 #endif
01514     }
01515     else {
01516         if (m_cursorGrab==GHOST_kGrabHide) {
01517             m_system->setCursorPosition(m_cursorGrabInitPos[0], m_cursorGrabInitPos[1]);
01518             setWindowCursorVisibility(true);
01519         }
01520 
01521         if(m_cursorGrab != GHOST_kGrabNormal) {
01522             /* use to generate a mouse move event, otherwise the last event
01523              * blender gets can be outside the screen causing menus not to show
01524              * properly unless the user moves the mouse */
01525             XWarpPointer(m_display,None,None,0,0,0,0,0,0);
01526         }
01527 
01528         /* Almost works without but important otherwise the mouse GHOST location can be incorrect on exit */
01529         setCursorGrabAccum(0, 0);
01530         m_cursorGrabBounds.m_l= m_cursorGrabBounds.m_r= -1; /* disable */
01531 #ifdef GHOST_X11_GRAB
01532         XUngrabPointer(m_display, CurrentTime);
01533 #endif
01534     }
01535 
01536     XFlush(m_display);
01537     
01538     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01539 }
01540 
01541     GHOST_TSuccess
01542 GHOST_WindowX11::
01543 setWindowCursorShape(
01544     GHOST_TStandardCursor shape
01545 ){
01546     Cursor xcursor = getStandardCursor( shape );
01547     
01548     XDefineCursor(m_display, m_window, xcursor);
01549     XFlush(m_display);
01550 
01551     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01552 }

01554     GHOST_TSuccess
01555 GHOST_WindowX11::

01557     GHOST_TUns8 bitmap[16][2], 
01558     GHOST_TUns8 mask[16][2], 
01559     int hotX,

01561 ){

01564                                     16, 16, hotX, hotY, 0, 1);

01567 
01568     GHOST_TSuccess
01569 GHOST_WindowX11::
01570 setWindowCustomCursorShape( 
01571     GHOST_TUns8 *bitmap, 
01572     GHOST_TUns8 *mask, 
01573     int sizex, 
01574     int sizey, 
01575     int hotX, 
01576     int hotY, 
01577     int fg_color, 
01578     int bg_color
01579 ){
01580     Colormap colormap= DefaultColormap(m_display, DefaultScreen(m_display));
01581     Pixmap bitmap_pix, mask_pix;
01582     XColor fg, bg;
01583     
01584     if(XAllocNamedColor(m_display, colormap, "White", &fg, &fg) == 0) return GHOST_kFailure;
01585     if(XAllocNamedColor(m_display, colormap, "Black", &bg, &bg) == 0) return GHOST_kFailure;
01586 
01587     if (m_custom_cursor) {
01588         XFreeCursor(m_display, m_custom_cursor);
01589     }
01590 
01591     bitmap_pix = XCreateBitmapFromData(m_display, m_window, (char*) bitmap, sizex, sizey);
01592     mask_pix = XCreateBitmapFromData(m_display, m_window, (char*) mask, sizex, sizey);
01593         
01594     m_custom_cursor = XCreatePixmapCursor(m_display, bitmap_pix, mask_pix, &fg, &bg, hotX, hotY);
01595     XDefineCursor(m_display, m_window, m_custom_cursor);
01596     XFlush(m_display);
01597     
01598     XFreePixmap(m_display, bitmap_pix);
01599     XFreePixmap(m_display, mask_pix);
01600 
01601     XFreeColors(m_display, colormap, &fg.pixel, 1, 0L);
01602     XFreeColors(m_display, colormap, &bg.pixel, 1, 0L);
01603 
01604     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01605 }
